meanings.definition: A large open boat used by Eskimos.
meanings.sent1: The oomiack glided smoothly across the water.
meanings.sent2: The Eskimos loaded their supplies onto the oomiack.
meanings.sent3: The playful seals followed the oomiack, curious about its passengers.
meanings.sent4: The oomiack was a sturdy vessel, like a floating home on the sea.
meanings.sent5: The colorful oomiack stood out against the icy backdrop of the Arctic.

meanings.sent1: They oomiacked to the fishing grounds early in the morning.
meanings.sent2: We will oomiack to the next village for the festival.
meanings.sent3: The friends decided to oomiack together for a fun adventure.
meanings.sent4: She oomiacked through the waves, feeling the cool breeze on her face.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, they continued to oomiack towards their destination.

meanings.definition: The act of using an oomiack for transportation.
meanings.sent1: The oomiacking of goods along the river was a common sight.
meanings.sent2: His job involved the oomiacking of people between islands.
meanings.sent3: The oomiacking competition drew a large crowd of spectators.
meanings.sent4: She admired the skillful oomiacking of the experienced boatmen.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of oomiacking has been passed down for generations.
